page.title: 05Medical care 1925
page.content:
NEWBRIDGE IN 1925 (contd) researched by Liane Davies
The boys could attend boys clubs and snooker,billiard halls.It was common to see children playing in the streets because there were no playing areas,and there was very little traffic in the streets.
Q.What was the standard of medical care like?
Medical care was very poor,because all types of treatment had to be paid for unless you were too poor,then you received treatment under the Means Test which meant people came to visit your home to find out your financial state and if it was below poverty standard you would be granted free treatment.
